publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3558# Shona Robison: The Tayside Project—That the Parliament commends Marie Curie Cancer Care for joining forces with NHS Tayside, Dundee City Council, Perth and Kinross and Angus Councils and the Scottish Ambulance Service to deliver the first Scottish project of the Delivering Choice Programme in Tayside, which aims to look at the problems in palliative care provision in the region before developing a strategy to deliver the best possible palliative care and end-of-life care for patients in the area, allowing them to be cared for in the place of their choice; notes that Tayside has specific problems in this area, with 75% of the admissions to the cancer centre in Ninewells Hospital being for palliative care, and that over the three-year project issues like this will be tackled, and believes that the findings of the project should be utilised in other areas of Scotland to inform palliative care policy so that everyone in Scotland can benefit from this ground-breaking project.
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr John Swinney*, Richard Lochhead*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) John Swinburne*, Michael Matheson*, Shiona Baird*, Donald Gorrie*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) Brian Adam*, Bruce Crawford*
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) Elaine Smith*
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S2M-3558# Shona Robison: The Tayside Project—That the Parliament commends Marie Curie Cancer Care for joining forces with NHS Tayside, Dundee City Council, Perth and Kinross and Angus Councils and the Scottish Ambulance Service to deliver the first Scottish project of the Delivering Choice Programme in Tayside, which aims to look at the problems in palliative care provision in the region before developing a strategy to deliver the best possible palliative care and end-of-life care for patients in the area, allowing them to be cared for in the place of their choice; notes that Tayside has specific problems in this area, with 75% of the admissions to the cancer centre in Ninewells Hospital being for palliative care, and that over the three-year project issues like this will be tackled, and believes that the findings of the project should be utilised in other areas of Scotland to inform palliative care policy so that everyone in Scotland can benefit from this ground-breaking project. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr John Swinney, Richard Lochhead, Christine Grahame, John Swinburne, Michael Matheson, Shiona Baird, Donald Gorrie, Patrick Harvie, Brian Adam, Bruce Crawford, Elaine Smith, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Bill Aitken*, Mr Jamie Stone* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) Dennis Canavan*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Alex Neil* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Irene Oldfather* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-3558# The Tayside Project (lodged on 11 November 2005) Jackie Baillie*, Mr David Davidson*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Dr Jean Turner*
